body_html:
Before you start to training model, you can run jetson_clocks.sh, it will let your tx1 enable high performance.
$ ./jetson_clocks.sh

I am not sure tx1 is same or not.
$ sudo nvpmodel -m 0
When you running your training, you can run tegrastats to check your memory.
$ sudo ./tegrastats

Could you run this to check your available memory ? It can check the max amount memory for your gpu.
https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/974063/jetson-tx1/caffe-failed-with-py-faster-rcnn-demo-py-on-tx1/post/5013784/#5013784

body:
Before you start to training model, you can run jetson_clocks.sh, it will let your tx1 enable high performance. 
$ ./jetson_clocks.sh

 I am not sure tx1 is same or not.
$ sudo nvpmodel -m 0 
When you running your training, you can run tegrastats to check your memory.
$ sudo ./tegrastats

Could you run this to check your available memory ? It can check the max amount memory for your gpu.
https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/974063/jetson-tx1/caffe-failed-with-py-faster-rcnn-demo-py-on-tx1/post/5013784/#5013784
